channel.title: NPR Topics: News
channel.description: NPR news, audio, and podcasts. Coverage of breaking stories, national and world news, politics, business, science, technology, and extended coverage of major national and world events.
channel.copyright: Copyright 2024 NPR - For Personal Use Only

item.title: Here's the 2025 list of Most Endangered Historic Places in the U.S.
item.description: This year, the annual list from the National Trust for Historic Preservation includes a mysterious castle, flooded communities in Florida and North Carolina, historic hotels and a gigantic turtle.
item.content:encoded: This year, the annual list from the National Trust for Historic Preservation includes a mysterious castle, flooded communities in Florida and North Carolina, historic hotels and a gigantic turtle.
item.dc:creator: Neda Ulaby

item.title: Many Afghans living in the U.S. fear being tortured or killed if they get deported
item.description: Roughly 200,000 Afghans came to the U.S. after the Taliban seized control in Afghanistan in 2021. Many are worried about their future as President Trump has steadily eliminated legal protections.
item.content:encoded:
Roughly 200,000 Afghans came to the U.S. after the Taliban seized control in Afghanistan in 2021. Many are worried about their future as President Trump has steadily eliminated legal protections.

(Image credit: Sayedyaqoob Qattali)
item.dc:creator: Andrew Schneider

item.title: SCOTUS upholds Trump's transgender military ban. And, the papal conclave begins
item.description: The Supreme Court has allowed the Trump Administration to start executing its ban on trans military service members. And, the conclave to elect the Catholic Church's new leader begins today.
item.content:encoded:
The Supreme Court has allowed the Trump Administration to start executing its ban on trans military service members. And, the conclave to elect the Catholic Church's new leader begins today.

(Image credit: Win McNamee)
item.dc:creator: Brittney Melton

item.title: Fighting loneliness in rural Maine, one casserole at a time
item.description: What happens when people put their phones down and eat together?
item.content:encoded:
What happens when people put their phones down and eat together?

(Image credit: Marsden Shetterly)
item.dc:creator: Caitlin Shetterly

item.title: More states are allowing community colleges to offer bachelor's degrees
item.description: Diminishing access to four-year universities and majors has been holding rural students back. Community colleges say they can bridge the gap.
item.content:encoded:
Diminishing access to four-year universities and majors has been holding rural students back. Community colleges say they can bridge the gap.

(Image credit: Mike Rundle for The Hechinger Report)
item.dc:creator: Jon Marcus

item.title: Word of the Week: Before the Birdman of Alcatraz, the island was known for its birds
item.description: The origin story of Alcatraz's name is a complicated mix of language, a history that dates back to the first Europeans to explore the coast of California, and, a flock of seabirds.
item.content:encoded:
The origin story of Alcatraz's name is a complicated mix of language, a history that dates back to the first Europeans to explore the coast of California, and, a flock of seabirds.

(Image credit: Justin Sullivan)
item.dc:creator: Scott Neuman

item.title: The Fed will likely hold interest rates steady as Trump's tariffs spark uncertainty
item.description: The Federal Reserve will likely hold interest rates steady Wednesday as President Trump's tariffs threaten to raise prices and drag down economic growth.
item.content:encoded:
The Federal Reserve will likely hold interest rates steady Wednesday as President Trump's tariffs threaten to raise prices and drag down economic growth.

(Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)
item.dc:creator: Scott Horsley

item.title: Kari Lake says OAN's far-right coverage will fuel Voice of America
item.description: Senior presidential adviser Kari Lake says Voice of America will rely on coverage from the far-right OAN network. OAN has offered unwavering support of President Trump.
item.content:encoded:
Senior presidential adviser Kari Lake says Voice of America will rely on coverage from the far-right OAN network. OAN has offered unwavering support of President Trump.

(Image credit: Jose Luis Magana)
item.dc:creator: David Folkenflik

item.title: U.S. and Chinese officials will meet in Geneva in first sign of thaw in trade war
item.description: The superpowers have been locked in a geopolitical blinking contest, waiting for the other side to reach out. The talks in Switzerland are the first concrete sign of a potential thaw in the deadlock.
item.content:encoded:
The superpowers have been locked in a geopolitical blinking contest, waiting for the other side to reach out. The talks in Switzerland are the first concrete sign of a potential thaw in the deadlock.

(Image credit: Ng Han Guan)
item.dc:creator: Sherisse Pham

item.title: WeightWatchers files for bankruptcy protection to eliminate debt burden
item.description: WeightWatchers said Tuesday it is filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to eliminate $1.15 billion in debt and focus on its transition into a telehealth services provider.
item.content:encoded:
WeightWatchers said Tuesday it is filing for Chapter 11 bankruptcy protection to eliminate $1.15 billion in debt and focus on its transition into a telehealth services provider.

(Image credit: Richard Drew)
item.dc:creator: The Associated Press
